review_text: We had a wonderful time at your lakeside house! The house was the perfect size for our family of 3, and the location is so beautiful and peaceful. Cindy was a great communicator and was really willing to go above and beyond if necessary - when we visited there had been an unexpected (and short-lived) snow storm the night beythat knocked power out at the lake house. Cindy kept us informed about the power status and even offered to let us spend the night in another studio property that she has for a night if we needed to. Fortunately the power came back on right before we were ready to check in! The kitchen was well-stocked and had everything we could have asked for.

review_text: I had a lovely stay at this airbnb, the home is very clean and new. It was nice being next to the water and watching the ducks and eagles flying around. The home feels like stepping into an interior design magazine and the beds are comfortable. Cindy was a wonderful host who checked in with me on the first day and allowed me privacy the remaining days. While I stayed in the winter season I am sure the summer season would be wonderful since there amenities like the kayaks that would be perfect for summer. I especially loved the lake view from the living room and it was very calming and peaceful. I highly recommend this place!

Words can’t express but I will try, this home was so comfortable and complete with everything you needed to feel at home away from home and then some. If you were to move in this home, you wouldn’t need anything but your clothes. It was so beautiful inside and out. Inside is like you would see in a magazine. The outside is just as nice . Very well lit up inside and out. First class barbecue, with a rotisserie Cindy purchased at my request. Cindy went out of her way to have everything we needed.
I haven’t even mentioned the views. To wake up in the morning, get your coffee and to look out over the lake and watch the ducks swimming and flying over the lake was so peaceful. The beautiful deck in the back , wall to wall windows to see from inside as well. Last but not least, is the train echoing over the lake with a beautiful sunset was like being in a movie.
I was so impressed that we are spoiled for future vacations. Cindy Thank You so much for sharing your home with us 😊

name: Ash
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
1 week ago
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
Anne was a welcoming and flexible host. The accommodation was private and perfectly equipped. We were in Olympia to visit our daughter and her wife and were able to host them for a cooked meal given the excellent kitchen facilities and living area. The accommodation was equipped with everything we needed and Anne had also provided snacks, tea, coffee, milk and even a bottle of wine to help us settle in.
The local co-op store (open 7 days a week) and Bits cafe (open Fri, Sat, Sun) were very handy and the free bus (no 45) into Olympia or out to the Mall made a useful alternative to walking or using the hire car.
The local area was a quiet peaceful residential area and we felt very safe walking around at any time of day or night. There was also a pleasant woodland path and bayside park to walk to.
The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed the outside seating area. We definitely plan to stay with Anne again, the next time we are over in Olympia!

rating_info:

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We stayed at Anne's place for 5 nights and felt right at home from the moment we stepped into Fern's Cottage! It was wonderfully stocked and the little extras were such a welcoming and kind touch. The cottage is cozy and the bathroom was nice and spacious (which sometimes isn't always the case for smaller dwellings). The outside was beautiful and peaceful, and we had such a restful time. We both work from home and found the wifi speeds were great (worked well for the video calls I had!). If we need to stay again in the area we would return in a heartbeat, and definitely recommend this place for anyone visiting Olympia or the surrounding areas. Thanks again for a great stay, Anne!

Well-furnished without being cluttered. And free of intrusive air scent products - Hurrah! For me, it's also very walkable to downtown- through the residential neighborhood & across the bridge.

review_text: I highly recommend this property. Anne's place was perfect for me as a solo traveler. It was SUPER clean, had lots of thoughtful amenities, a well-stocked kitchen, and a well-stocked bathroom. She left coffee and some snacks which was above and beyond. The space is updated and well laid out. The location is perfect, close enough to walk along the water and to walk to restaurants and stores if you wanted. The bed was extremely comfortable, I slept great! The outdoor space is peaceful. Anne was easy to communicate with and a very gracious host. I will book again if I can when I return. :)

review_text:
Stayed for 2 weeks. Needed a quiet, restful place to spend Christmas. Chose this lovely cottage for the high end finishings and gorgeous little kitchen. We are from scratch cooks and found the kitchen well stocked for the most part. Enjoyed cooking on the induction stove and being a short walk (less than 5 minutes) from the excellent organic produce at the Olympia Food Co-op. Bed was comfy, neither super soft or super firm.
Notes for future renters:
The hair product was a combination shampoo/conditioner so if you have easily tangled hair, bring your own conditioner. Great place for 1 person, or a couple comfortable with each other given the lack of privacy. It was perfect for us as a married couple. We would stay again.

Anne provided everything you need including extra pillows, extra towels, and binders with information about local amenities and attractions. The kitchen was well equipped. The little patio and garden area are very nice and private. It is a pretty quiet place to stay and still be close to downtown Olympia. Check in was a breeze since Anne leaves clear instructions for you. Wifi worked great as well! I hope her place is available the next time I am in the Olympia area.

The cottage is set in the back of the host's house but there is plenty of privacy and a patio just for the cottage. The bed is very comfortable and super quiet. review_text:
To say that Anne’s place was perfect would not be an exaggeration. It is a beautiful, newly built, well-stocked and comfortable studio with some separation between kitchen, dining/sitting and sleeping areas. Anne has enhanced the space with a number of thoughtful, lovely touches, stocking the fridge and drawers with everything you will need and in addition to the usual and expected, also provided bars, half&half, coffee, tea, drinks, cheese and crackers, books, maps and brochures about Olympia and nearby attractions, and even a bottle of wine.
The house is on a hill above downtown, but it is easily accessible by a short walk or bike or drive. Anne also was very responsive and promptly answered questions we had. If/when we return to Olympia I’m sure we will visit this home again.

review_text: Anne’s cottage is one of the nicest Air BnB studios I’ve stayed in. The bed is very comfortable with nice linens and pillows. It was stocked with absolutely everything and anything I might need. She thoughtfully provided cold drinks, cheese and crackers, a nice bottle of wine, coffee, half n half, and condiments/seasonings. The unit looks brand new with many personal touches, interesting art, and local maps and guidebooks. The views of trees out each window and a patio area make it a very pleasant place to stay. I visit family in Olympia occasionally and would definitely stay there again if it’s available. Anne responded promptly to my questions and graciously let me check in early.

review_text:
Anne is a gracious and accommodating host. I was forced to change the duration of my stay once I had already arrived, and she was fantastic in responding to the change and communicating with me about it.
The self-contained cottage is immaculate and well equipped with all the conveniences. The location is excellent.
The host lives in the adjacent home. The cottage used to be the garage, and the two structures are close to one another. For somebody not used to having a host present, this is something to consider.
The guest shares a driveway with the host.
The bed is on the far end of the soft scale, meaning that it is very soft. I found it to be too soft.

review_text: Anne's Fern Cottage was a magical place to stay. It was clean, comfortable, and quiet. I have a disability, and there has never been an easier place to access. All walks were paved, there are no steps in, and there is a walk in shower with a seat. The floor was not over crowded with furniture dodge. Anne went over the top with a bottle of wine and a few snacks to make someone feel right at home. Very close to shopping areas, and the local food Co op was just around the corner. I would not only stay here again myself, I would also recommend it to anyone I knew that was traveling to the Olympia area.

review_text:
The location of the property was close to everything you could want including the local food Cooperative which was nice. The accommodations are well appointed with everything you could need for cooking, coffee and snacks. Anne left some lovely yummies in the fridge including some very delicious coffee!
Provided in the studio was cooking items including oils, spices and coffee/tea/ cocoa to enjoy while you watch your morning programs. There is outdoor seating area to enjoy your tapas or a book. The studio is fully ADA equipped with bathroom that will accommodate someone who is not able to stand which a wonderful! Air conditioning was a plus as well due to the time of stay was during a heat wave. Anne, your host, is wonderful and highly recommend staying here when you travel to Olympia!

Anne's place was spectacularly clean and well stocked with everything we needed and much more. Communication with Anne was fast and clear, and check in was a breeze. The neighborhood was quiet, and we walked out to downtown multiple times. This was one of the best Airbnb we have stayed at, and we will certainly look for Anne's place the next time we visit Olympia.

review_text: Fern Cottage is an absolutely charming and delightful accommodation. Anne couldn’t have been more gracious and communicative. There were so many special little touches throughout, and the cottage was impeccable and incredibly clean and spacious. Most Airbnb‘s don’t come with quite the extensive amenities that were available throughout, including generous kitchen items and ample supplies in the bathroom. Access was also wonderful and the location of the cottage itself was incredibly convenient to all the areas in Olympia one would want to get to. I would absolutely recommend Fern Cottage and if we ever had a need in the area, it’s the first place we will call. Anne is a wonderful host!!

,

June 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Having stayed at Ana and Leika's place before, I knew what to expect and everything went very smoothly just as before, including pre-arrival communication, check in, and check out. Because I was in town on business, I wasn't around much during the day--was mainly there to sleep, shower, and eat breakfast--but while I was there, I felt very much at home. Although the bathroom is shared, it was always available when I needed it, and there was good off-street parking and plenty of refrigerator space for my three days' worth of groceries. Since the last time I stayed with Ana, she's taken in a couple pets which are both clean and well-behaved--Ana also checked with me to make sure that I didn't have pet allergies before I stayed. And since it was very warm when I stayed--it was in the 90s on one day--I appreciated that Ana already had a fan running in my room when I checked in and the room remained cool enough that I didn't have much trouble sleeping. Ana remembered me from my previous stay, so it was fun to catch up. I'd be happy to stay with her again!

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was my second stay at Anna’s place, and everything was pretty much as before—efficient check-in/check out, very neat and tidy space, and Anna remains a friendly and gracious host. Since I had stayed with Anna a few months earlier, there wasn’t need for an extensive check-in but Anna was around in case I had any questions and she also let me borrow her iron even though it wasn't included as one of the amenities inside the room. As with my previous stay, I was here for work so I wasn’t at the house much except to sleep and eat breakfast. This time, I found the freeway connections and commute to be a lot easier to navigate, although I did leave before the 8 am rush and was coming back at night well after evening rush hour—if you’re coming from the westside of Olympia/Tumwater after 8-9 pm on a weekday or even on Sunday afternoon, that stretch of 101 to I-5 is nice and clear. Unfortunately, I still haven’t had a chance to explore the area much, but this time I saw that there was a Safeway near the freeway and Anna’s place also appears to be close to the highest-rated Italian restaurant in Tumwater, so I’ll be sure to check those out next time I’m in town. During my previous stay, I found Farrelli’s to offer a decent pizza in a part of Lacey that’s maybe 10 mins. away by car Anna’s place, so that’s another reason to come back in addition to the good value and convenience that Anna’s place provides.

name: Albert
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I had a nice stay at Anne’s place, which is well represented in the photos provided on Airbnb. The entire place is very neat and tidy, and even though I was only there to sleep and eat breakfast, it appeared to have everything anyone would need to be comfortable. Anne has set aside room in the kitchen fridge for you and the individual bedroom also had a lock with key that provides an extra measure of security. Anne checked me in herself, and provided perhaps the most thorough check in I’ve had at an Airbnb. And in case you forget anything or check in yourself, she also has a handy preprinted guide that you can consult, complete with photos and detailed instructions for off-street parking. This was my first stay in Tumwater, and I found that this safe, quiet suburban location provides easy access to Olympia just an exit or two away on the freeway (also accessible by surface streets). It was easy to find Anne’s place from the freeway, but it’s a little tricky getting back on when you leave the first time—just make sure you use GPS or consult a map for that first foray. This was also the first time I’ve stayed at an Airbnb with a shared bath, but it was easy to coordinate—any possible inconvenience that might arise from a shared bath seems to have been considered in the pricing, which I believe to be quite fair. In any case, Anne is a friendly, very well organized host who’s excellent at communication… Even before this stay, I had already booked a second stay later in the fall and I’m already looking forward to returning…

review_text:
Comfy & cozy in Olympia.
This was our first time in Olympia and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Peggy's place was comfortable and clean with just the right amount of amenities to get us going in the morning (microwave, toaster, Keurig, water cooler, etc.). Peggy's suite has really easy access to downtown Olympia and the I5, plus a nice neighbourhood bakery right around the corner.
Peggy also, tastefully, laid out some extra snacks, coffee pods, tea bags, and even spare toiletries. A VERY appreciated gesture.
Check-in/out was easy with the keypad door lock and it was easy to find out way to the suite.
The Mission Creek Nature Park (accessible through the back gate on the property), was a beautiful spot for a walk and to bask in the Pacific Northwest Nature.

review_text:
Peggy has created a beautiful, home away from home, place to stay. We arrived after an unexpected long day of travel at 4:00 pm without lunch; we found snacks in the kitchen. A life saver for us! She has created such a comfortable, warm and inviting little house. The bed was very comfortable, lovely linens, a clean bathroom with a place to put our toiletries, great blow dryer and bathrobes! Towels for makeup, clean shower and even a floor heater.
The kitchen had a hot and cold water dispenser for tea, hot chocolate and a Keurig for coffee. Refrigerator, toaster and little table for breakfast. Seriously, Peggy, you are amazing!!! We loved our stay and would HIGHLY recommend her place to anyone staying in Olympia.
Peggy is responsive, kind and delightful. Thank you Peggy for going over and above as you prepared your lovely place for travelers. Happy New Year!

review_text: Peggy's place is such a lovely space. The entrance brings you to your own private porch overlooking the backyard. Inside was immaculate and inviting. The bed was big and comfy with wonderful quality sheets and comforters. The gas fireplace next to the bed kept us really toasty and provided wonderful ambiance. Great, large TV positioned so it was easy to watch from bed and had lots of channels to watch. The bathroom was very well thought out, and Peggy provided thick, lush towels and nice smelling soaps and lotions. In the breakfast nook, there was plenty of room to store cold stuff in the fridge / freezer. We used the microwave, but not the toaster oven or coffee maker, but Peggy provided lots of snacks, hot apple cider, hot chocolate and coffee. Internet was very good and there were plenty of outlets to charge our phones and computers. Highly recommend Peggy's! Close to everything!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Peggy's home is quite truly the best AirBnB I've stayed in. She's clearly thought about the needs of her guests and anticipated those needs. I really appreciated everything she's done. The bed is so comfortable, the linens lovely, and with a choice of layers to easily warm up or cool down. The kitchenette is thoughtfully stocked - hot beverage options with coffee, teas, cider, hot chocolate, and I really appreciated the snacks and oatmeal options. There are breakfast and other dining options in driving range, but so nice to be able to start my morning quietly. I've stayed in other places remote from any options including coffee shops that didn't even bother with a coffee maker, not nice! It was very cozy snuggling into a movie alone after a fun but busy day visiting with my small grandkids. In the morning I sat with my coffee by the window looking out at the garden which I will love to visit during the growing season. It looks amazing even in winter! Thanks, Peggy!

From the beautiful gardens where we were offered to pick delicious fresh raspberries to the comfy space/bed, luxurious linens, fluffy towels, etc. etc.etc. everything was perfect!! We stayed till the very last minute as we hated to leave. I highly recommend staying here and my recommendations do not come lighty. As an added bonus there is a small park a few houses down that provides for a great little nature walk in the early evenings.
Thank you again Peggy for setting us up with the outdoor fireplaces, which was a treat given we are from FL and it isn't often we get to relax by a fire. We hope to come back one day!!!

Stayed about a week
review_text: Oh boy, I don’t think I have enough space to say what I need to! Stet and Lynn were wonderful hosts that helped usher in our first experience in the Pacific Northwest! Stet was there to greet us and gave us everything we needed and more! The location was wonderful, and we were within a short drive to access the Olympic and Rainier national parks! We did plenty on our trip, but waking up with the view of Burns Cove while sipping coffee (that our hosts graciously provided) in the rocking chairs and watching the wildlife had to be the best way I’ve spent mornings in recent memory. The grill and chairs outside were also wonderful way to soak up the view. So peaceful and serene… part of me wishes we just hung out at the cabin even more! Stet and Lynn were flexible with us at checkout, and were a resource for us to talk with. They were also eager to find out what we did so they can share it with future guests— now that’s good hosting! They were a blessing for my wife and I— highly recommend!

review_text: Stet and Lynne were amazing host. Stet met us outside in the dark with a flashlight when we arrived and showed us right in to the cabin. He explained all the amenities inside the cabin and we were on our way to spending the first night there. What a peaceful place and an amazing view of the bay and the sunrise in the morning. We saw seals and birds in the bay during the day. Stet had the tide tables available for us and binoculars as well so we could have a better view. The cabin was equipped with everything you need for a getaway and the also had raisin bread and homemade granola for us which was delicious. Every morning we made our way to the barn to say hello to the horses and chickens and feed the horses some hay. They had a guest book where you can write about yourself and your stay at their cabin and were blessed to see a deer right by the porch on our last morning there. It was so much fun. We will gladly book again for our next stay in the Olympia area. Thank you!

As other reviewers have mentioned, the bathroom and shower are small & the only sink is in the kitchen area. That wasn’t a problem for us. Great value. review_text: Stet and Lynne are very friendly, accommodating and knowledgeable about the area and willing to offer advice about the area. The cabin is prefect for me and wife, it has the essentials and also includes extras like fresh eggs and homemade canola. The property is like a nature preserve, with great views of the bay from the covered deck. We have often seen bald eagles, deer (fauns in June time frame) and lots of water fowl (blue herons, ducks, and loons) and seals. There is a very good walking trail just up the road through an old growth forest. The property is in relatively close proximately to Olympia for restaurants or shopping. This property is a great place to stay!

Stet was a great host meeting us as we pulled up. Gave us the key and made sure we had everything we needed including firewood for the small woodstove. The cabin was very clean. The small but efficient kitchen was stocked with homemade granola, coffee, filters, eggs, bagels, and milk to keep is going until we were able to get to the store.
The cabin has a great view perched right at the edge of the water. It is small though and although it did note this in the listing I don’t think I realized just how small the bathroom space was. If you are a larger person you may find the small shower a little too small and there was not a sink in the bathroom area meaning the only sink is in the kitchen.
All of this is in the cabin listing but I feel like a picture of the bathroom area would have been helpful in making our decision to stay as ultimately it ended up being a little too small for us, especially during the cold rainy winter months when getting outside is more of a challenge.

One note that I missed in the listing description - there are motion detector lights outside the cabin that can be disabled via a lightswitch just inside the door. They would turn on occasionally overnight - reading comprehension fail on my part for not realizing they could be turned off entirely!

review_text: The cabin was perfect for my wife and I during a 1 week stay. The cabin has all of the necessary appliances and was comfortable. The deck with a covered portion was great for grilling and having dinner on the deck while watching the great views of the inlet. The views from the living room are equally good. The location is very quiet, no road noise and the inlet is shallow, so practically no boat traffic, which made for a very peaceful stay. During our stay in early June we saw 3 new born fawns, Bald Eagles, Blue Herons, and many rabbits. Stet and Lynn were very helpful with information about the area. I would highly recommend the cabin for any length stay.

This is a great getaway for one person or couple (a double bed) looking to refresh, renew or relax. Stet is very hospitable and a very knowledgeable guide and storyteller about the area. As I was working while there, I left wishing I had had more time just to enjoy it!

I consider myself a Cabin expert. No, I don’t know about building them, or architecture, or really anything else substantial, but I do know how it feels to stay in them. This cabin is the gold standard. A full 10 out of 10. Amazing view of the sound from the living room of the cabin. High-quality yet simple kitchen. Amazing location. A wood-burning stove! But best of all, the hosts. Extremely kind and welcoming, and left me some fresh baked snacks and some other wholesome foods upon my arrival. (I like food, especially given in such a kind way)
The area is super fun to explore, and really good for taking long walks. I used my time for meditation, and working on some creative projects. I cannot wait to go back again. I left feeling recharged, calm, and delighted.

name: Jessica
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This little cabin is the perfect place to unplug and take in the beautiful scenery. Stet was quick to respond to any inquiries that we made prior to our trip. He was detailed and thoughtful when it came to directions, greeting us at the driveway and making local recommendations. When you pull in there is a long gravel driveway, then the horse stalls, the main house, and your parking spot. You walk down a gravel path behind the main house, through the backyard about 100 feet to the cabin. The cabin was clean and warm upon arrival. The woodstove was set up and ready for us to light whenever we wanted to. There were spices, cooking oils, condiments, granola, fresh eggs, coffee, creamer and all of the kitchen things you would need to be able to make a nice meal. The bed was comfortable and so were the sheets/duvet. We both liked the shorter rocking chair lol, it was comfy. The bathroom is extra small but, it has the necessities. Stet & Lynn have a great guide that they leave for you. It outlines the property, nearby stores and favorite places, hospitals and safety information. The wifi was great, we streamed a movie on Netflix through our laptop and were able to watch a movie without any buffering. We stopped by and fed the horses each day that we were there. They were happy to see us when we walked up and we're friendly. We walked down a little trail to the water and saw oysters at low tide. There were different birds in the area and we liked the binoculars and bird book they set up at the window for us to use. Such a nice getaway, affordable and much more beautiful than the photos. You should definitely go if you're thinking about it!

Every little touch in the cabin was great. The bed was comfortable, the rocking chairs were a great touch. Stet is very responsive to any questions you text him, and he’ll remind you often that he’s always willing to help with anything during your stay - such a friendly guy! Be sure to spend some time with the horses, they’re adorable and both Lynne and Stet can tell you some interesting facts and stories about caring for horses. The cabin has all of life’s basic needs - a shower, a toilet, running water, hot water, stovetop, toaster oven, and pans and dishes. The view from the cabin is amazing, especially during sunrise. It’s the perfect couple’s weekend getaway! I definitely want to come back soon!

review_text: This cabin is an absolute gem! My best friend and I met at Stet and Lynne's place for the most relaxing girl's weekend we could have hoped for. The view is spectacular and you will lose time just rocking in a chair and staring out over the water, trying to identify all of the birds (we saw eagles and cranes, among many others). The cabin is well-furnished and cozy with every amenity we needed to make ourselves delicious meals (including plenty of breakfast items - farm fresh eggs, yum!) and firewood enough to keep a crackling fire going. Stet made sure we had a table upon which to do our puzzles (a favorite pastime) and Lynne dropped by mid-day on Saturday with biscotti hot from the oven (with the most delicious ginger orange glaze, fabulous!). We took the walk suggested in the welcome packet and passed through the barn on our way to say hi to the beautiful carriage horses. Check in was a breeze and Stet provided very detailed instructions on how to find their place. We can't recommend this cabin and these hosts enough!

review_text: I enjoyed the tranquility of this cabin with its wide view of Puget Sound thru 2 large picture windows! A wood stove, nice kitchen, comfy bed, and really nice hosts. Everything I needed and in many ways much more. An opportunity to rest, contemplate and enjoy the natural surroundings. Easy to find; about 10 min to the main highway.

Stet was the perfect host with detailed directions and met us out front for a tour of the cabin. Nice and close to Olympia if you need anything but even on a cold January day, it was difficulty to move ourselves from the picture window and rocking chairs. At one point we were about to head out and an eagle flew past the window and start going after some fish ~50 yards away. Will definitely go back.

Our recent stay was as wondeful as our first. Close to downtown Olympia and the National Forest. But no need to go far since the cabin has a picturesque view of the water.

My only suggested addition would be footstools for the rocking chairs, or perhaps a small sofa. I'm looking forward to staying again!

review_text: This cabin and Stet’s hospitality is nothing short of amazing and perfect. The cabin was even better in person. It has everything you need inside (just no oven) but it’s not a must. There’s an electric microwave oven and an electric stove so that was perfect. Being RIGHT on the lake is completely surreal, you have a complete view of it from two big windows in the cabin where you can sit in the rocking chairs and just enjoy. Stet also has carriage horses which he lets you feed carrots, pet and interact with if you want to. I can go on & on about this stay—overall it was perfect and I highly recommend this space to anyone looking for a quiet, calm and serene stay by the water with surrounding nature.

We were visiting for a workshop and didn't spend as much time in the cabin as we ultimately would have LOVED to, (we're thinking a week staring at the water next time!), but it was so wonderful to have HOME to come home to! Thoughtful touches abound at this property. Stet and Lynne couldn't be nicer and the view from the rocking chairs was unreal every day and changed every 10 minutes. Comfy bed with plenty of bedding and pillows, great kitchen setup and a pre-set fire. Warm and toasty inside and out. Book it. You won't regret it.

This is the sweetest of refuges nestled in under the trees with a stunning and peaceful view of the water. Quiet and beauty surround. It was also an easy 20 minute drive to and from downtown Olympia where I was taking a dance workshop.
Stet and Lynne are the most gracious of hosts. I felt taken care of in every way from the moment I booked to the moment I left. Everything from the prompt and welcoming communications from Stet, the video tour, the wood stove being stocked and ready for use, the fresh and homemade breakfast selections, to the welcome from Lynne with fresh garden flowers made this a delightful stay in every way. They went above and beyond.
I highly recommend this cozy retreat cabin and I can’t say enough about the welcoming hosts.

Stet is a kind, courteous, and thoughtful host. He gave good recommendations of places to walk/hike within an hour of the cabin. We had a restful and happy stay. Thank you!

It is stocked with pretty much everything you need if you're staying there a couple days, including towels/bath things, food, dishes, wood burning stove, linens, etc. It's a relaxing getaway from the city, and it's still close to it. I'd stay here again, and I'd recommend it for anyone considering it.

name: LuAnn
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2018
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Stet and Lynne’s cabin on Totten is a sweet little get away place where you can surround yourself with the best of the northwest. If you spend time watching the waterfront you will see eagles and osprey and many seabirds feeding. The seals like to come into the bay and you can see the oyster and clam fishery activities. There are many great hikes nearby and we kayaked from Young’s cove nearby and Arcadia point. Stet and Lynne can help you with local info and they are great hosts. The cabin had fresh farm eggs, homemade granola and coffee and was a comfy place to relax. It is close to Olympia for a great farmer’s market, waterfront boardwalk and cute shops and eateries. We also liked walking the Capital campus and lakefront and Priest Point park in Oly.

name: Abigail
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2018
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is hands down the best traveling experience my husband and I have ever had. Stet and Lynn have outstanding hospitality, easy check-in/check-out, a fully stocked cabin with breathtaking views, and horses!
There were thoughtful touched through out the day entire cabin which made our stay all the more special. We cannot wait to come back!!
We spent most of our time at the cabin but did venture out one of our days to Olympic national parks Staircase trails. It was a scenic drive and only about an hour away. Definitely worth it if you like hiking.

name: Courtney
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is the place to stay for calm, peace, tranquility and right on the water. Photos don’t do this cabin justice. The deck is warm and inviting with all the flowers and it wraps around the cabin. There’s chairs to sit outside and just watch the wildlife on the water. If you aren’t into sitting outside, there’s two rocking chairs inside facing the oversized windows and the views are just as great. Bed was comfy and sheets were clean and very soft. There’s extra toiletries in the bathroom if you forget something. Only word to the wise is there’s no sink in the bathroom...only the sink in the kitchenette. Didn’t bother me a bit but you never know. Will stay here again if and when I’m back in the Olympia area.

The location is quite far from Seattle so if you are planning to go to the city it is quite a trek so plan accordingly. But if you are looking to get away from it all, this is the perfect spot to do it.

But in the mean time, if you're trying to decide where to stay in close proximity to adventures around or in Olympic National Forest/Park with a nice place to come home to or just looking for a peaceful stay this is your place!

review_text: Cozy and peaceful! This is a great place for a quiet retreat, a base for daytrips to kayak and hike, or even a respite for a business traveler. I was surprised how quick the trip is from I-5 and downtown Olympia--only 15 min. It's a safe choice if you're traveling alone; Stet and Lynne are right next door, available and helpful, but leave you to do your thing. They introduced me to the horses and told me about a neighborhood trail through the woods. I loved the special touches of cozy flannel sheets and homemade granola.

On the other hand it's a perfect place for doing outdoors , I e.g. did a lot of hiking. Stet and Lynne are wonderful hosts. Kind, responsive, helpful with great ideas what to do but also respecting your privacy at any time. I loved to be their guest. I would always come back and can recommend this place 100%.

name: Polly
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Stet’s cabin is a lovely secluded retreat. We enjoyed the time to look out over the water at the birds, and the occasional seal and sea otter whilst enjoying a beer and snacks that we brought.
Stets place is well appointed with kitchen essentials so that your basic morning coffee/tea and food needs are covered. This is a very nice touch, so that you can take your time in the morning, rather than realize you have to drive into the market for a forgotten item. Much appreciated.
We picked up some local oysters and cooked them up on the grill, and we got to put our kayaks in twice, at boat launches that were about a 30 minute drive away. Delightful. All in all, the Puget Sound experience we were looking for.
Thank you, Stet!

If we could give more than 5 stars we would. Thanks!!!

We really appreciated how Stet already had the stove loaded with wood and paper for us. We were able to stream movies using the internet connection. The cabin was stocked with home made granola, fresh ground coffee, and milk and cream, and eggs. We slept so well on the comfy bed. Only wished we could have stayed more than two nights.

I’d love to go back and stay at there place again.

Stet was very communicative with us, letting us know that the cabin would be ready earlier for check-in if we'd like and making sure to be there to greet us when we arrived. We appreciated his quick walk-through of the place and notes that were in the cabin with everything that we may need. The granola and coffee were delicious but the real treat was the view of the Sound! It was hard to leave the quiet and solitude that Stet and Lynne's cabin provided for our weekend. We would absolutely recommend this cabin and hope to return soon!

I will absolutely return in the future. The value of this rental can't be beat.

Responsive hosts kept us well supplied with breakfast foods and firewood.

The wonderful view, extremely comfortable bed, and wood burning stove were exactly what we were looking for on our short relaxing getaway from city life. It was beyond peaceful. Would stay here again in a heartbeat if given the opportunity!

My boyfriend and I have both lived in the Northwest for our whole lives and have never had the opportunity to visit the Olympic Peninsula. Stet pointed us in the right direction for us to have the perfect day trip complete with plenty of hiking, exploration and oysters from Hamma Hamma. We cannot wait to return!

I wish I could post pictures I took of the sun setting over the water, of the frozen fields in the morning with fog caught between the trees. Other guests have surely said it before, but it's truly a magical place. Stet's hospitality was the cherry on top; you can definitely that he goes above and beyond for his guests. We'll surely be back!

The cabin is a wonderful place to come and relax in a quiet and serene environment. Unplug yourself from the city, and enjoy the ducks on the water, or the quietness of the trees standing still, ominous, and witnesses of what being alive really means.
My wife and I enjoyed our first anniversary here. We plan to come back, maybe in the summer if it is available.
Thanks to the host! Stet was very hospitable and made our stay an unforgettable one.

name: Jennifer
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

December 2017
,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: I had a fantastic time at the cabin. I was really impressed with how clean and well stocked it was, and the bed linens were so soft. And the view! It is just fabulous. Constantly changing and always beautiful, the Puget Sound really makes itself known in this space. It took my breath away a couple times, between complete zero visibility fog ,to a huge sunny purple and gold sunset, and giant moon over the water, all in a two day visit. Plus all the birds you can see right there from the living room. I went in December and was warm. Also, the host is extremely nice and an interesting person.

name: Taya
rating_info:

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This cabin is such a gem! Located right on the water, it was lovely to see so many birds and boats at different times of the day. Being in the woods, we also got to see deer. Peaceful, quiet, and lovely place.
Stet and Lynne were great hosts; quick to respond and accommodating.
Would definitely stay there again!

name: Stephanie
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
November 2017
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Consider yourself lucky if you can reserve this cabin. It is charming and has waterfront views of Puget Sound. Every morning we were able to watch seabirds, and saw a seal one day. Not only is the cabin on the wayee, but it's in the country, and we saw deer every day. All this, and it's only 15 minutes to the middle of town. One star off for the miniscule shower - it really was quite uncomfortable. *Note that the bed is a full size, so if you have more than one large person in it, you'll be cozy! *Also note that cabin has been updated from some previous reviews and now has a small, 2-burner stove top. No regular oven though, just a toast oveb, but that is not an inconvenience.

Very nice and cozy cabin by the water! The cabin is very clean and has almost everything you need from freezer to microwave to shower. They even provide you some stuff for breakfast which we found very convenient. The best was the little fire stove, although it wasn't that cold we used it a lot. It added a lot to the atmosphere.
The hosts leave you alone if you want to be alone, if we needed help or had questions they were immediately there to assist or arrange things.
All in all very great experience!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place is sooooooo sweet. We were warmly greeted with so many personal touches and thoughtful accommodations. Aside from the amazing view, the cabin itself has everything for a short or long stay and is well supplied for stove top cooking. It is also surprisingly spacious with ample heat sources including the easy to use wood stove. The location isn't really that far from the highway but it seems like you've found a hidden gem in the middle of nowhere. It's close to many state parks that are easy to get out and enjoy. We had a perfect trip with falling leaves, northwest rain, even snow and a rainbow off the deck, all in the same 2 days. Truly a perfect experience.

The fantastic accommodations included a picture window with a view of the sound in a cabin with a nice kitchen and comfy bed. And the special touches made the stay even more memorable. The cabin was stocked with books on trails and birds... amazing homemade granola, yogurt, and fresh-groun coffee for breakfast, and the surprise of cookies on arrival, great granola and yogurt breakfast. Thank you Stet and Lynne so much for such a nice stay -- I wish I had more time there!

From the living room the view is stunning and you can perfectly relax after long days. For us it was the base to explore the Olympic national park and the location is pretty convenient since you can access both the east and the west coast of the park.
Lynn and Stet are perfect hosts, the communication was absolutely amazing and they even provided us with food and homemade specialities that were unbelievably tasty.
We would definitely come back and recommend the cabin.

Wow! This place is amazing! The view off the back deck (and view from window) is breathtaking. I can't describe how relaxing it is to sit and take in the view with total silence. Like others have mentioned, it's really quiet -- the only sound you'll hear is an occasional bird. I never thought watching the tide roll in and out throughout the day would be so entertaining. The cabin is well equipped to prepare meals. We enjoyed eating dinner on the deck watching the sunset. The property is quite beautiful with two friendly horses, Tally and Kippy, and lovely gardens full of flowers and vegetables.
Stet and Lynne are the most gracious hosts you'll ever encounter. They'll give you all the privacy you desire however we enjoyed visiting with them and appreciated thier advice on all the great things to do in the area.
This is truly a wonderful place. We can't wait to return!

rating_info:

January 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: I lived here for 3 months during a home remodel. The view out the windows every morning to look through trees at the waters of Budd Bay Inlet was such a peaceful way to start the day; I'm going to miss that. Really comfortable gigantic bed, plenty of room to store clothing and other things I brought from home. The one thing I missed was more kitchen capacity but this is a small space and it was what I expected--a "heat things up" space (toaster oven, microwave, gas cooktop, no full oven, smaller refrigerator). Our cat loved looking out a small window in the bedroom to watch birds pecking at the ground below. I bike for transportation and this is a great place to stay if you ride! Easy flat trip to downtown for restaurants, groceries, entertainment, and a beautiful ride the other direction if you want some hills and mileage with a bike lane and then shoulder. Beautiful Squaxin Park is close by with forest trails and access down to the water to watch birds and the occasional seal.

review_text:
I loved staying here! Elena is a phenomenal host! She was responsive and even brought one of her personal deck chairs down to my level so I could read outside and sip my coffee.
I hike A LOT! So I actually didn't stay in the Airbnb the entire week, as I was camping in Leavenworth and stayed in Seattle for a night. BUT...when I was there, that bed was SO COMFY! It was PERFECT for my rest days, especially after my 22 mile hike to Aasgard Pass)
Things to know if you hike:
-Leavenworth for Colchuck Lake and Aasgard Pass is 4 hr drive from Airbnb
-Mt. Rainier is a 2.5 hr drive from Airbnb (left at 12 am, so this is travel time with no traffic)
-Seattle Airport is about 1.5 to 2.5 hours, depending on Seattle traffic .
-Lastly, Squaxin Park is walkable from Elena's Airbnb. Squaxin Park has "Telephone of the Wind " which is why I actually booked this trip. This is where you go to send your loved ones (my daughter, Eliza) who have passed away messages to be carried by the wind...

The bed is COMFORTABLE

The accommodations are IMMACULATE

Notes:

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The apartment was just recently renovated with all new decor and some appliances such as washer and dryer. There was coffee and tea provided and new microwave and fridge also. The bedroom was spacious, and the bed was comfortable. Bathroom is new and was stocked up nicely with soaps, shampoo and clean new towels. The front room is large enough for small dining table and a pull-out sofa bed to sleep an additional 2. The location is perfect for a getaway with partial view of the bay and short driving distance to Olympia historic downtown. The location is very easy to access, huge amount of parking and exceptionally clean everywhere. There is also access to a beach in the bay across the street within a 5 min walk. We watched the sun set over 3 nights. Elena's communication was excellent she welcomed us on the first night and provided many recommendations for local restaurants and places to visit. As with many newly listed and newly renovated places there are some minor issues that Elena addressed immediately upon contact. My wife and I had a beautiful time, and the location is perfect, fantastic restaurants and for a short romantic getaway we would definitely consider returning in the future. Thankyou Elena!

The unit is next to the carport that is shared with another guest space so can be noisy when another guest is arriving/departing or idling their vehicle.
The unit shares a hot water heater with two other units, so my second morning I waited about an hour for the system to recharge. Not a major issue as I had time to wait.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay was perfect.
The location makes all parts of Olympia and Lacey easily accessible.
The first thing we noticed is the tray with the snacks and 2 bottles of water. Such a nice welcome.
The space is inviting. Lots of light, but has black-out curtains that allow you to sleep in.
The portable a/c worked perfectly. Kept the space nice and cool.
Love that shampoo, conditioner and body was provided. Shower was nice. Pressure from the showerhead is good. But let me tell you, those TOWELS! We took a picture of the tag so we can buy some for home.
The bed was super comfortable.
We had plenty of room to park our 2 motorcycles in the covered carport.
We can't rave enough about Joshua's place. Highly recommend!
Thank you for your hospitality.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Evergreen Room is nice because it has a treehouse feel. It's part of a house that's built on a slope, so although you enter on the street level, the view out the back is from the second floor. Lots of big trees around the property offer a sense of privacy. The house is located on a street that starts off a little rough from the main road (residences with deferred maintenance, fence graffiti, etc.), but the farther up the street you drive, the nicer the neighborhood gets. The house itself is well-maintained, and we enjoyed our stay. The host emailed us midway thru our visit to offer extra towels, and to ensure we were comfortable. He provided some chilled water bottles and a basket of snacks, which were appreciated after a long drive from CA. Overall, the room was quiet, secure, clean, spacious ... we would recommend. We had a great time in Olympia!

Loved our stay and recommend if you are coming to Olympia area!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·
August 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We spent 4 enjoyable nights here while exploring the Olympia area. We found Stephanie's place to be very homey and comfortable. The floorplan is a bit unusual as the walk-in door enters into the bathroom, which is spacious and includes a closet. There's a sliding door off the other room. The kitchen was well supplied for two. We cooked several meals there and found nothing lacking for simple cooking. The bed is a futon style that can be folded up into a couch. The place is located at the end of a street bordering a greenbelt area, so there was no traffic passing by and the neighborhood was very quiet. We very much enjoyed meeting and interacting with Stephanie and the goats and cats that she obviously loves and takes very good care of. We hope to return soon and will definitely stay here again.

The surroundings are so quiet and lovely with the woods all around, yet you are a short drive to downtown Olympia. We had a lovely breakfast and then went to the farmers market and it was a mere 5 minute drive away.
The host is very responsive and pleasant to chat with. She is very welcoming!

She even let us take the goats for a morning walk around the neighborhood. This is such a great stay and Stephanie is the best host. She was communicative, flexible, kind, and helpful. The place itself was cozy, clean, and comfortable. The goats are a joy! I have to mention how Stephanie went above and beyond to help me; I had a sprained ankle and my job is a physical one. This meant that I needed lots of rest time between job activities and Stephanie ensured I was able to rest and recover as much as I needed to. She was super easy to get a hold of and always ready to help if needed it.
Also this spot is great. Very close to downtown, as well as parks that are good for walking, running, or hiking.
I would absolutely stay here again, and look forward to being able to walk with Stephanie and the goats next time!

review_text: Stephanie's Airbnb is one of a kind. We are so glad to have stayed with Stephanie on our trip back from Olympic National Park. Stephanie is such a gracious host! We really enjoyed getting to know her. She gave us a tour of her beautiful vegetable garden, let us feed catnip to Ozzie the cat, and join a morning hike with Mac and Dutch the goats, which was so much fun! And there is the awwsome four legged welcome committee: Ozzie the cat, Mac and Dutch the goats. We had so much fun hanging out with them. The city of Olympia is a hidden gem, and Stephanie’s place is an oasis surrounded by natural but yet so convenient to get to great restaurants and shops in downtown Olympia. We’ll sure be back on our next trip to Seattle Area.

name: Alexandria
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

June 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This cozy studio was everything we could've asked for and more. It was very clean and organized. We felt at home and had everything we needed provided at the studio for our 6 day trip. The studio included hotplates and plenty of dinnerware for nights we didn't feel like going out. The shower was one of my favorite touches; it really made for a relaxing night after a full day of hiking. Stephanie is welcoming, kind, and friendly. She was very easy to talk to and showed some of the best hospitality I have ever experienced. Mac, Dutch, and Ozzie were a real treat! We had a blast walking Mac & Dutch on our last night. It put a smile on my face every morning seeing them before we went on an adventure. The location of this Airbnb was perfect! It was nice and secluded while at the same time being centrally located to many beautiful places. We were about an hour and a half away from Seattle, Mt. Rainier, Ocean Shores, and more. When we were too tired to spend another day hiking, we spent the day in Olympia. It is such a cute city and had a lot of good food choices! The studio is a few minutes away from one of the best pastry shops we have ever had (We had to resist going a third time!) If we ever make it back out to Washington, we would love to stay here again!

The studio was immaculately clean and equipped with everything a traveler might need (and might have forgotten to pack) like towels and washcloths.
As well if you’re looking to save some money on food she provides a microwave, clean dishes and cups, silverware, a cooking grittle with pans, pots and utensils.
If you stay here you’re missing out if you don’t ask for a walk with Mac and Dutch. (the goats) They love meeting travelers and posing for pictures.

name: Meghan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2020
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Stephanie runs an ozone cleaner after every guest leaves. She washes every bed linen, including the blankets and the bedspread.
Good stop en route to (or on the way back from) Ruby Beach and Olympic National Park (the south-west sides of the park).
I was working from home during the week. The wireless internet was fast and Stephanie had lots of tea bags, Kashi snacks, and Lara fruit bars in the kitchen that came in handy when I was busy working. The kitchen has a microwave and a small fridge. Firm but comfortable bed for someone who doesn't like futons or lumpy mattresses.
I look back fondly at my stay here. When the air quality in the SFBA, the Portland area, and the Seattle area was horrible (among the worst in the world), Olympia was a rainy spot near the many trees of the Olympic National Park - where the air quality was perfect. A soggy refuge during some traumatizing wildfires.

review_text: We live in Olympia and were looking for a fun weekend staycation. This houseboat exceeded our expectations and made for a fun and unique experience. Due to the lovely weather we were able to spend lots of time on the rooftop deck, drinking coffee in the morning, eating dinner and lounging in the evening under the sweet hanging lights. During low tide there is fun sealife visible right off the back of the boat. The amenities were plentiful and we had everything we needed to prepare meals and host my parents one night for a bbq dinner. The marina is quiet with a sweet and friendly community feel. The hosts were extremely responsive to all my communications. We hope to come back soon!

One of my favorite unique stays now 💙 I originally came across this when I was out walking and it was tied to a different slip. I was so sad when I thought it was gone! I’m a tiny home enthusiast and noticed the house was well built and easy to manage! I was pleasantly surprised. Sometimes you come across some weird quirky things. It was enjoyable, peaceful, & the people at the marina are so friendly. ((If it any moment you consider selling it, call me first 😅 but I hope ya’ll keep it, it’s such a gem!))
The porch is easily, one of the best features of the home. Some of the sliding glass doors will open so you can still get the breeze and water feel from inside, but still safe for children with the railing. I’ve never seen my kiddo so content! The hosts were prompt & easy to contact for any questions and concerns. Thanks again for such an enjoyable stay!
-a

Love this charming and peaceful spot! Host was kind and communicative, getting there was clear and easy, and looks exactly as pictured. The deck was a perfect spot for drinks and coffee, the bed was comfortable, we had what was needed to make a quick breakfast, and Tugboat Annie's next door made for an enjoyable dinner. The jellyfish and birds the next morning were also a fun bonus! Would definitely stay here again.
Recommendation for my fellow night owls: the bedroom gets lots of natural light coming through the blinds in the morning, so pack an eye mask if you're a vampire who prefers a dark environment to sleep in to ;)

review_text: What a wonderful, unique experience; fell in love with the boathouse right away. We arrived late evening and the entrance way was still enticingly lit up, the inside was welcoming and felt like a home. Every detail is so well thought through, from decor to cleanliness, neatness, attractiveness, to everyday needs of their guest. It is immaculately clean and tidy. The ambience is brilliant, even down to the comfortable temperature, inviting scents and dreamy deck. The host is very generous with a check-out time of 12:00pm so we were able to enjoy a little relax in the morning sunshine on the deck. We also enjoyed the opportunity to purchase a wine of our choice from a good little collection. All in all this boathouse is an amazing place and we feel privileged to have stayed.

When I go on any trip the first question I always ask myself is: "Is this an experience?" My aim is always to find the unique, the charming, the downright interesting and fun places/things/experiences.
The House Boat checked that box off completely! Not only is it an absolute odditty I would see on a listicle of unique stays - it was also comfortable, cute, and cozy.
The stay was clean, the balcony I could live on (and practically did playing cards until the sun went down), and Tugboat Annie's was a great restaurant right down the boat ramp.
I would highly recommend this place for any traveller that loves an experience and getting off the beaten path.

name: Jennifer
rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay was unsatisfactory for a couple reasons: cleanliness and smell.
The major cleanliness issue was the portable air conditioner, which was sitting in a tub of water full of pink and black bacteria when we arrived. The drain was clogged, so instead of fixing it, the AC was placed in the tub.. The AC unit itself was dirty. Outside tables had food encrusted on them. There were numerous spider webs inside and out housing spiders.
The smell was putrid. There were 8 air fresheners in the small houseboat: 4 in the small bathroom, 3 in the salon and 1 upstairs. The air fresheners added to the smell instead of masking it. This smell was only in the houseboat, the dock smelled fine. I grew up boating in Puget Sound and am familiar with the smell of water and tides, this was the houseboat.
We cleaned the AC tub, opened windows to try to air it out and swept away the webs. We stayed 1 night instead of 2 due to the smell.

review_text: This boathouse is SO cute! Marian has thought of everything. It was super clean and comfortable. Air conditioners and heaters on both floors. The view of the city was lovely at night. There is a restaurant right on the marina so you never really need to leave to area. We also enjoyed a cute cafe up the road for breakfast. This was our first time on a boathouse, but we were suprised at how nice the bathroom and shower were! We never ran out of hot water and it was updated nicer than most other airbnb's we have stayed in. Highly recommend this rental. You won't regret it!

This place is so amazing! The pictures did not do it justice and the experience of staying on a houseboat was worth every penny. I can’t stop talking about what a cool place this was.
It’s a quick drive to the downtown area and there is a cute restaurant/bar right in the marina parking lot that you can walk to.
The host really thought of everything, including offering beer and wine for a small fee for convenience.
I hope I get to stay here again!

The photos do not so this place justice. It is immaculate! Sitting on the upper deck watching the lights of the city over the water was absolute heaven. It is just a quick drive to the Olympia Farmers Market and tons of fun little shops. There is a great little restaurant in the marina, just steps from the home. Try the milkshakes, you’ll thank me.
We can’t wait to book another trip.

The houseboat is close to downtown Olympia and its numerous coffee shops which made it easy to head there each morning for breakfast. The best feature of the property, by far, was waking up each morning and watching the birds (cormorants, mergansers) diving for their fish breakfast in the water around the boat.

Communication with host and co-host, Chris, were excellent and check-in/out was a breeze. It's about a 5 minute drive to Capital Lake and the down town area - so close to all the things we wanted to do. Having Tugboat Annie's right there was also a plus..We thoroughly enjoyed hanging out on the deck with a glass of wine watching the sites. West Bay Marina is a bit run down, but don't let the initial view upon arrival sway you. The people are all very nice and friendly and it's very quiet at night. We really did enjoy our stay In this lovely boat house.

Stayed one night
review_text:
Excellent and unique spot for a beautiful Olympia stay. The floating home is truly charming, thoughtfully appointed and set up beautifully to enjoy gorgeous views on its awesome deck.
A couple of things to note: The house is moored at an active marina with relatively few other house boats and a number of live-aboards. It’s neither a top-end marina, nor a dump. Expect very close neighbors (though the house has plenty of curtains and blinds for privacy), and a fair amount of boat traffic. Nothing bad - We very much enjoyed our stay - but worth knowing.
Highly recommended. Great stay!

review_text: My stay on the houseboat was unique, cool, fun, and ultimately too short - I was just beginning to enjoy the marina life when I had to leave. Great views, comfortable bed, super clean, good layout. I enjoyed sitting out on the deck/patio and seeing great blue herons and seals, plus the amazing view of the water and state capitol. Parking was easy, and the marina folks were friendly. I will repeat something mentioned in other reviews - Marian is a thoughtful, caring, and excellent host. I would love to stay on the houseboat again.

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My husband and I stayed for two days at the houseboat for a fun break for our drive to Seattle. It was definitely a unique experience and fun way to see the Puget Sound and the capital (there’s a great view from the upper deck at high tide). The boat was very accommodating will all supplies you could want or need. The shower surprisingly had great water pressure but as Marian instructed, the showers need to be quick due to the size of the hot water tank. Marian was a wonderful host and had great communication during our stay! We had one issue with the smell of gasoline inside the houseboat and Marian sent his business partner immediately to inspect to ensure everything was in working order. The marina does have some unique smells at low tide. We were able to enjoy dinner right at the marina at Tugboat Annie’s while there and also Anthony’s hearth fire grill which both had wonderful views of the water! We would definitely stay again!

name: Ali

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place is heaven on the water. It’s a very very cute, modern, and clean house that’s also a boat! Waking up to wildlife was so joyful for us- the bird life was abundant. We loved the deck and seeing the full moon rise over the capital. The bed was cozy and the couch was just paradise! We loved the little electric fireplaces, the unique shower, and the views!
I will be real and say, it’s a boat- you can feel the motion of the tide at times. That wasn’t a problem for us at all- I find myself missing the gentle motion now that I am firmly back on land. Just want folks to be aware as it could be an issue for some…
Also, I rarely say this but one of the best parts about this Airbnb was the host! Marian made us feel so welcome and offered real kindness that made our stay super special. It’s obvious that the hosts love this place and care about making it feel like a retreat.
We can’t say enough good things about this place. Until next time…

What a beautiful little spot! We definitely plan on returning when it isn’t the middle of the PNW winter to enjoy that deck. Regardless of the rainy and cold weather (which we knew was likely in January) we were warm, cozy and comfortable. The cabin is small but very well equipped and smartly arranged- we had everything we needed.
Watching the fog and rain roll through and the tide changing was beautiful. We even lucked out with a perfectly timed break in the clouds our last morning. The sunrise is INCREDIBLE at this little cabin with Mt Rainier visible from bed! Super secluded and private but close enough to town if you want to head out for dinner. We also took the drive up to Hamma Hamma for oysters for the afternoon.
Already planning a return, which I think says it all!

It has lot's of glass windows so that you can enjoy the breathtaking views of Mt. Rainier and the Salish Sea! It feels very private and you are right down on the waters edge with a private deck. We loved everything about this place. The bed was very comfortable and the gas fireplace added such a nice cozy feel during the colder weather. Megan was very responsive whenever we had any questions or concerns. We are 75 years young and did not have any issues with the stairs. We would love to come back for a longer stay. We would highly recommend.
Thank you Megan!

Our stay at Beverly Beach House was one of the very most relaxing times we have ever had, anywhere! The location of this studio cottage is on a beautiful bay of the Puget Sound looking directly across at Mt.Rainier and also down to the State Capital building. The deck juts out over the beach and, when the tide was in, we felt like we were on a ship. We also had the feeling of being in a tree house, with the privacy that the trees provided.
The apartment had everything we needed and was very tastefully appointed. The bed was perfect.
Lazy days and kayaking ( supplied by the host), what could be better!
Also, Megan was very helpful and, though honoring our privacy, was very responsive to our usual kinds of requests. I enjoyed our satisfying conversations.
We WILL be back!!!!!!!!

Had everything you need: view, sunrise/sunset, comfy bed, bathroom with necessary supplies already offered, towels etc , kitchen had everything you need. Very easy to find too. Fabulous peaceful place to relax after a long day of adventure. Owners communication is fantastic. Thank you again for a first time stay in Washington from us Georgia folks. Also for exploring travelers: we stayed for 3 days. Seattle was only an hour drive. Mount Rainer a two hour drive. Olympic National park an hour- went all the way to Forks & La Push total of 3 hours there and back. This was a perfect middle ground and downtown Olympia is also super cute.

The private beach was great for taking walks along the water's edge. The path down to the cottage is so pretty with all the lights. My only concern was parking our vehicle because it was a tight squeeze getting into the space. I was worried we might back into something but there were no problems! I would highly recommend!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: My husband and I enjoyed a three night visit which did not disappoint in this cozy little cabin on the bay. It was January and the weather was a little too cold to just sit on the deck, so I really appreciated the wall-to-wall windows for enjoying the spectacular views! The little cast iron fireplace provided the perfect ambiance in the evenings. The cabin decor is stylish and the bed/bedding is very comfortable. The full-size bath tub was sparkling clean and nice to relax in. My husband appreciated the tall, wide shower head, (which is sometimes an issue for him when we travel). Our hosts went above and beyond by promptly assisting us with a dead car battery on our first day there. I’ve never had a host answer messages so quickly, also offering lots of suggestions for places to visit in the area. We enjoyed the local Bayview Thriftway store for our groceries. But those views though! I had many of my Facebook friends ask me for the listing just based on the pictures I was posting. It’s rare to feel like you’re literally staying right above the water with the sound of the waves! 🌊

World class views at moderate hotel room prices! I had to book this trip at the last minute due to unforeseen family events and I couldn't have found a better deal. In the same price range as hotel rooms in Olympia, the Beverly Beach House provided a quaint and private experience with the aforementioned views just 15 minutes away from downtown. Meagan was attentive but not obtrusive and her flexibility and understanding allowed me and my visiting family to connect and enjoy our time together. Your neighbors include plenty of deer and the occasional seal swimming on past while you get to take in amazing views of Mt Rainier over Budd Bay. If you're looking for a quiet oasis from the traffic and noise, this is the perfect place for you. Thank you Meagan!
Will Leque
Portland, Maine

This place was AWESOME! Meagan contacted us prior to our trip to let us know the weather conditions. Asked if we needed anything before we arrived. The pictures do not do any justice! Growing up in Washington and now living in California this place almost makes me want to come back home! The view and the water and on the final day of our stay Mt. Rainier showed herself. It had been snowing and raining the days before. Do not pass this little gem up! Meagan thank you again. Btw. I never got to read what my girlfriend wrote in the book. But she did take a picture of it. So maybe one day I’ll know
Mark

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Such a great peaceful and quiet location. We loved watching the seagulls and few boats pass by. We enjoyed walking the waters edge with our dog while the tide was out and sitting on the porch listening to the water as it hit the barrier wall below us when the water was in. Mount Ranier greeted us in all her glory when we arrived. The mornings were foggy but brought another level of serenity to this special place. Highly recommend it if you want peace and quiet. Olympia is a short drive and we headed over to the farmers market for some fresh steelhead and oysters. Meaghan our host greeted us with some lovely local wine! We will definitely come back again.

Do not hesitate to book this beautiful relaxing space with amazing views! It is exactly as pictured and well stocked if you like to cook while away. An added plus was the small BBQ on the deck. The deck is also the perfect space to unwind or relax and read a book. The beach is very walk-able and if you kayak there are many enjoyable areas to see launching right from the cabin. Lots of bird life on the shore with the occasional seal swimming by :)
The town of Olympia is a close drive to stock up on what you need during your stay. Don't miss the great Farmers Market downtown!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: It is hard to overstate how perfect of a romantic getaway this place is. It was our second time here, and I didn't know how it could have been better than our first visit, but it was! We had been in December, and even though it was cold outside we had the amazing fireplace going to heat us up. This time, the weather was perfect to have the double doors open with the fresh air rolling in. Honestly I don't think we've ever stayed anywhere that was more conducive to unplugging, relaxing, and just spending quality time together. I HIGHLY recommend Beverly Beach House! Bring a book, a bottle of wine (or enjoy the fantastic wine that Meagan has waiting) and unwind. We will absolutely be back!

The gas fireplace was wonderful and heated the room up very quickly. When the tide was up, we felt as if we were sitting on top of the water. There were games, movies and cds to play. We walked along the beach and met some nice people who had just purchased a home down the way. It's a quiet, friendly area. We would go back for sure. Thank you, Meagan!

review_text: This was our first airbnb trip, and honestly, we couldn't be happier. Everything was even more amazing than we had hoped. The room was perfectly clean, and had everything we wanted and more! It was very private, cozy, and quiet. Down to every detail in the cabin, everything was of high quality. From the super warm down comforter on the bed, to the awesome espresso machine (I'm desperately going to miss). Meagan was great, and happily accommodated our requests to make sure we were comfortable. The view is absolutely incredible. Even though it rained most of the time we were there, we barely noticed. We just cranked up the fireplace next to the bed and sat out on the balcony. We were even lucky enough to be there on the weekend they had a Christmas boat parade! This is truly a gem, and we will most definitely be coming back!

I would definitely stay again and recommend to friends/family traveling in the area.

name: Jacquie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2015
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This property was wonderfully tucked in to the trees of this peninsula and then opened up just enough along the beach to place this perfect sized small cabin-like home. The driveway is one of a kind and beautiful - only to be matched by the long walkway of 35 ivy covered steps to the doorway of this clean and comfortable small, one room cabin. The cabin is made up of one comfortable queen size bed in the center of the room but it is surrounded by a small dining table in the picturesque windows over the bay, a modern kitchenette, and an electric wood stove for chilly nights! The full bath is clean and stocked with essentials! I loved finding a bottle of local wine on the table with two wine glasses ready for visitors to enjoy and relax. Venture out onto the patio and enjoy the bay views including wildlife and sailboats and evening city lights. A magnificent find for a quiet calm weekend or vacation getaway! Perfectly set above the water and the sound can lull you to sleep! Loved this location and plan to visit again!

Meagan is very friendly and helpful, but respects your privacy as well. It's a cozy little cabin with just about everything you could possibly need and some unexpected extra touches too! We enjoyed taking the kayaks out on the calm waters, picking blackberries along the beach, reading and relaxing on the deck and watching the tide come in and out. Less than 2 hours from Seattle and just minutes from downtown Olympia, but we felt like we were another world away. We'll be back!

name: Oliver
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Bungalow is simply sensibly set up. I stayed there several times for multiple reasons - it has a room that can serve as a separate bedroom for my kid, while I have the master bedroom. It has a well-equipped kitchen with everything you need to cook - there's not just a full gas stove, but a toaster, a toaster oven, etc. You can supply yourself here if you want that. There's a spacious shower that works well. There's air conditioning to keep the place cool, a gas oven to keep it warm if needed - fit for all seasons. Washer and drier - this can be a real home base away from home.
The place is also nice, with opportunities to sit outside, shielded by apple trees and bamboo from the street - and it's not a busy street. And yet you can walk on foot to downtown Olympia or uphill to shop -it's a nice neighborhood, we walked it many times.
Ellen herself has always been responsive on short notice when we needed something, a friendly host that respects your time there.

name: Terri
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
The location of this place is good for our needs. It utilizes green cleaning products and practices, which we admire. Two of us stayed here, and while I would stay again under certain circumstances now that I have seen the place, my family member would not. To be fair, I got the main bedroom with the luxury mattress, pillows, and linens. The main bed was extremely tall, and the ceiling was extremely low. I am 5'4" and had to jump/climb into bed, and I was able to touch the ceiling while standing on floor. I think low ceilings make me uncomfortable. I also felt really squeezed in while using the toilet. I did appreciate the lack of fragranced products in the space, as they cause headaches.
My family member got the uncomfortable twin bed in a cramped room which was missing window coverings on half of the windows, including the mostly-glass (frosted) door to the outside. They were counting on the room-darkening shades listed on the ad, and had a hard time sleeping in that room. They also thought the place smelled weird, which I had to agree with. Apparently raw douglas fir wood can give off that weird smell. Unfortunately, the smell, which was reminiscent of urine, was strongest in the small bathroom. There were two fans available for use, which helped them to sleep a little.
Kitchen and dining area had all you would need. It was stocked with beautiful dishware. It was a twist and squeeze to get into the fridge/pantry area. The bar stools did not seem to match the countertop height they were set to, unless you were a small child. The living area and library had built-in seats, made more comfy by many nice pillows.
The tiny AC unit, located in the farthest corner from the bedrooms, seemed like it would be a struggle on a very hot day. We arrived later and eventually made use of the cooler outside air.
The outdoor garden had several areas to sit and relax, with beautiful plants all around. The neighborhood was nice to take a stroll after dinner. It was a quiet residential area and we felt safe staying there.
This place is generally recommended unless you are tall or wide, or have a very sensitive sense of smell.

name: Oliver
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2021
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Stayed for eight nights in the Bungalow. It is shielded from the street, shielded from view by fruit trees. So much so the Uber Eats driver missed it twice!
Everything is as listed. A wall mounted AC unit keeps the main space cool, a gas heated fireplace gets it warm in no time. Kitchen stove works by gas, too, so does hot water.
There's a spacious shower, much appreciated. Two areas near the entrance have garden furniture to enjoy sitting outside. The home has been decorated with art and feels cozy and a bit quirky due to the many corners and storage areas, likely added over time.
As stated in the listing: no TV. Wifi works like a champ, though. You can wash and dry your own laundry on the premises, just coordinate with the host.
Speaking of host, Ellen was always quick to respond and helpful. She stocks the home well in toiletries, towels, cleaning and laundry supplies, better than other hosts.
As for noise, the street is rather quiet. If you keep the window open in the bedroom, there's some noise, maybe the AC unit in the other house on site next to it?
Area is in ready walking distance to downtown - five minutes - yet feels removed. Easy to walk to a grocery store in ten minutes. Free street parking, not overly busy.
It's good value for money overall, a great location, combining convenience with being less busy, good host, and good amenities.
